result.execSummary:
The defendant Triston M Sobrilski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent/Deliver Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
Provide DNA sample if not already provided.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time - First 6 months with Huber. Release for work and treatment. Credit for 2 days. Last 3 months STAYED and to be used at the Agent's discretion as well as to the huber or straight time.

records.addlTxt: 10:29 AM Defendant Triston M Sobrilski in court by telephone, in custody at Waukesha Huber, with attorney Mark Emil Kershek who appeared in person as a friend of the court.   Susan L. Opper appeared by telephone for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called to address motion to modify Huber.  Court addressed counsel and reviews the case.  Defendant is currently serving condition time requested by his Probation Agent; he is currently set to be released on April 15th.  Atty. Kershek presents statements.  Defendant presents statements.  Atty. Opper advises she filed a brief with regards to the motion; Court takes a brief moment to review the brief.  Atty. Opper presents statements.  Court finds the defendant was originally sentenced to Condition Time of 90 Days Huber stayed for use by the Agent.  Court finds the defendant has served 75 of those 90 days.  For reasons placed on the record the Court will order the Condition time be modified to be 75 Days Huber - time served; defendant may be released to continue with his Probation term.  Court orders that the remaining 15 Days Condition Time with Huber be stayed for use by the Agent.
Brief in Opposition to Sentence Modification filed by the State

Waukesha County Jail Inmate Correspondence from the defendant. 
The Court interprets the filing a request for modification of sentence and will address the matter accordingly.
DOC Amendment Order imposing 3 Months County Jail with release for work, school, and treatment as a condition of Probation that was previously Stayed.
Impose 3 Months County Jail with release for work, school, and treatment as a condition of probation that was previously stayed.
